definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: This is a good quality highway，and very wide.
sentences.chinese: 這是一條很高級的快車道，而且很寬。

sentences.english: Cocaine and heroin are fast routes to perdition.
sentences.chinese: 可卡因和海洛因是通往地獄的快車道。

sentences.english: The accident turned the freeway into a bottleneck.
sentences.chinese: 那起事故使快車道一下子變成了一個擁擠的狹口。

sentences.english: Life in the technological fast lane has them charging full speed ahead.
sentences.chinese: 科技快車道上的生活使得他們正在全速前進。

sentences.english: Bicycles are banned from the new motorway.
sentences.chinese: 自行車禁止通行於新建的快車道。

sentences.english: So, I say to you, forget about the fast lane.
sentences.chinese: 因此我對你說，忘掉那些快車道吧。

sentences.english: Work has been started on the new system of motor ways.
sentences.chinese: 修築新的快車道系統的工程已經開始。

sentences.english: My CCNA Online Fast Track is the world's fastest-growing CCNA course.
sentences.chinese: 我國網上萎快車道是世界上發展最快的崩解過程。

sentences.english: Cycling along the motorway is not allowed.
In recent years, China-Czech relations entered a period of fast growth.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，中捷關係發展駛入快車道。

sentences.english: The people of DongKou grip chance and go into the high speed way of developing economy.
sentences.chinese: 洞口人民抓住了機遇，跳上了經濟發展的快車道。

definition: (of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
to make an amphibious assault/to seize a beachhead/to gain a foothold in (a new market)
Checheng township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Four Asian Tigers/East Asian Tigers/Four Little Dragons (East Asian economic powers: Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore and Hong Kong)
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
pinyin: guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4
